title: PIMSLEUR - COMPLETE - [ENG] - LIBRE & VERITAS
description:
The Pimsleur language learning system is a language acquisition method developed by Dr. Paul Pimsleur. The system is centered around four main ideas: Anticipation, Graduated Interval Recall, Core Vocabulary, and Organic Learning.[1]

The Pimsleur method is an audio-based system, in which the listener constructs phrases or repeats from memory out loud along with a recording. The system is made up of multiple thirty-minute lessons, which are repeated until 70-80% comprehension is attained, at which point the user may continue to the next lesson. As the lessons repeat themselves and add new material, the system does not demand complete mastery of the material, since the material is reviewed at varying intervals throughout the course.[2]
